org.nodex.java.core

Interface Nodex


  • public interface Nodex

    An instance of Nodex is available to all event loops in a running application.

    It handles such things as setting and cancelling timers, global event handlers, amongst other things.

    Author:
    Tim Fox

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Nodex instance 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cancelTimer(long id)
      Cancel the timer with the specified id.
      java.lang.Long getContextID()
      Returns the context ID for the current event loop.
      void go(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Run the specified Runnable inside an event loop.
      void nextTick(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
      Call the specified event handler asynchronously on the next "tick" of the event loop.
      <T> long registerHandler(Handler<T> handler)
      Register a global handler with the system.
      <T> boolean sendToHandler(long actorID, T message)
      Send a message to the handler with the specified actorID.
      long setPeriodic(long delay, Handler<java.lang.Long> handler)
      Set a periodic timer to fire every delay milliseconds, at which point handler will be called with the id of the timer.
      long setTimer(long delay, Handler<java.lang.Long> handler)
      Set a one-shot timer to fire after delay milliseconds, at which point handler will be called with the id of the timer.
      boolean unregisterHandler(long handlerID)
      Unregister the handler with the specified handlerID.

    • Field Detail

      • instance

        static final Nodex instance

    • Method Detail

      • setTimer

        long setTimer(long delay,
            Handler<java.lang.Long> handler)
        Set a one-shot timer to fire after delay milliseconds, at which point handler will be called with the id of the timer.
        Returns:
        the unique ID of the timer

      • setPeriodic

        long setPeriodic(long delay,
               Handler<java.lang.Long> handler)
        Set a periodic timer to fire every delay milliseconds, at which point handler will be called with the id of the timer.
        Returns:
        the unique ID of the timer

      • cancelTimer

        boolean cancelTimer(long id)
        Cancel the timer with the specified id. Returns true if the timer was successfully cancelled, or false if the timer does not exist.

      • registerHandler

        <T> long registerHandler(Handler<T> handler)
        Register a global handler with the system. The handler can be invoked by calling the sendToHandler(long, T) method from any event loop. The handler will always be called on the event loop that invoked the registerHandler method.
        Returns:
        the unique ID of the handler. This is required when calling sendToHandler(long, T).

      • unregisterHandler

        boolean unregisterHandler(long handlerID)
        Unregister the handler with the specified handlerID. This must be called from the same event loop that registered the handler.
        Returns:
        true if the handler was successfully unregistered, otherwise false if the handler cannot be found.

      • sendToHandler

        <T> boolean sendToHandler(long actorID,
                        T message)
        Send a message to the handler with the specified actorID. This can be called from any event loop.
        Returns:
        true of the message was successfully sent, or false if no such handler exists.

      • getContextID

        java.lang.Long getContextID()
        Returns the context ID for the current event loop. The context ID uniquely identifies the event loop.

      • nextTick

        void nextTick(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
        Call the specified event handler asynchronously on the next "tick" of the event loop.

      • go

        void go(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Run the specified Runnable inside an event loop. An event loop will be picked by the system from all available loops.
